comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: That's a 1913 licence plate on the car in the photo. New York Times story, August, 1913, reports delay in enforcement of new regulations governing taxicabs in New York City -- ordinance would abolish private taxi stands, meter all rides, lower rates, require regular inspections: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9A0CE...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Mrs. Catharine Haverty, owner and operator of a New York City taxicab fleet, vows to defy strike that has idled her vehicles and drivers -- story in New York Times, November 13, 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B04E0D71E3EE2... Bain/LOC photo of Mrs. Haverty, seated in one of her taxi cabs: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4564873657/] (LOC gives her first name an incorrect initial, and misspells her last name as "Hayerty.")

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: and the strikes still continue, there was one a couple years ago, the more things change...
